Assigning a unique route to a component

NOTE: If you are not planning on including new components in the frontend elements of your plugin, go back to the index and skip the section on adding components to the frontend.

Before proceeding, be sure to have created the frontend component.

To assign a unique route to a component, follow these steps:

  • If it does not already exist, add the ui_routes property to your plugin config file and assign it an empty array value.
  • Add the following object to the ui_routes property array (replacing <plugin-name> with the name of your plugin, <component-path> with the unique path you want for your component, and <component-name> with the component name in kebab case): 
    {
    "path": "<plugin-name>/<component-path>",
    "provider": "<component-name>"
}
  • After following the above steps, for a component named example, the config.json file should resemble the following: 
      {
    "name": "example-plugin",
    "title": "Example Plugin",
    "version": "0.0.1",
    "description": "An example plugin.",
    "dependencies": [
      "dependency1",
      "dependency2"
    ],
    "api_namespace": "ExamplePlugin",
    "ui_filename": "example-plugin.umd.js",
    "ui_module_name": "ExamplePluginModule",
    "ui_routes": [
      {
        "path": "examplecomponent",
        "provider": "example-component"
      }
    ]
  }
